episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of quirky historical and modern facts, including Hungarian moustaches, the use of a club song for road safety, the benefits of soundproof classrooms, and the unexpected utility of WWII bomb sites for parking.

facts.fact: In the 19th century, some Hungarian cavalry officers got extra pay specifically because they had to spend so much money on wax for their enormous moustaches.
One of the most successful club songs of all time is mostly used to stop people from wanting to dance.
Children could learn to read faster if all lessons were held in a podcast studio.
Second World War bombings were useful for freeing up parking spaces.
